ygData.subject: Re: Languages *SPOILERS*
ygData.msgSnippet: As far as I can determine, The Wizard s Canon, Doctrine of Wizardry, and Ispor s Enlightenment III are written in Old Eurdin.  Ispor s Enlightenment IV however
ygData.messageBody:
As far as I can determine, The Wizard's Canon, Doctrine of Wizardry, and Ispor's Enlightenment III are written in Old Eurdin. Ispor's Enlightenment IV however is in Elder Tier'Dal. As for the books written in Elder Elvish, Combine, and Dragon, those are quest books that can't be bought from the merchants, but rather found through quests ;)

Yes, so far as I've been able to determine, Wizards only use Runes for their research.

Talarin Kal'Amon, High Elven Wizard


----- Original Message -----
From: Jean Astie
To: EQ_spell_research@onelist.com
Sent: Tuesday, May 11, 1999 5:49 PM
Subject: Re: [EQ_spell_research] Languages


Ken,

I know the Wizard's Canon (I guess some are calling this the first book...) is Old Erudian. Is the Doctrine of Wizardry written in Elder Elvish or Tier'Dal? I've heard there are four books yet you list 5 languages that you know or are working on. Are there more than four books? I really wish you were on my server. I'd happily pay 5 plat to learn those languages. Also, do wizards need ONLY runes?

Can anyone on the Karana server teach me other languages? I'll pay/trade for them... (I already know Old Erudian to excellent. I also have several non-rune reseach components I would gladly trade providing I dont need them myself.)
